abstract: Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, is joining the growing ranks of top banking executives who are giving up annual bonuses after a dreadful year in the financial industry.
snippet: Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, is joining the growing ranks of top banking executives who are giving up annual bonuses after a dreadful year in the financial industry.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, is joining the growing ranks of top banking executives who are giving up annual bonuses after a dreadful year in the financial industry.

headline.main: Bank of America’s Chief Gives Up Bonus
headline.print_headline: Bank of America’s Chief Gives Up Bonus

abstract: Mr. McGillicuddy assembled one of first big bank mergers in the wave of consolidation that emerged from the economic slump of the early 1990s.
snippet: Mr. McGillicuddy assembled one of first big bank mergers in the wave of consolidation that emerged from the economic slump of the early 1990s.
lead_paragraph: John F. McGillicuddy, who assembled one of first big bank mergers in the wave of consolidation that emerged from the economic slump of the early 1990s, the one between Manufacturers Hanover and Chemical Bank, died on Sunday at his home in Harrison, N.Y. He was 78.

headline.main: John F. McGillicuddy, 78, Banking Leader, Is Dead

abstract: Bank of America, raising cash to weather a dismal market at home, sold a $2.83 billion chunk of its holding in China Construction Bank on Wednesday, dragging the Chinese bank’s stock 6 percent lower.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America, raising cash to weather a dismal market at home, sold a $2.83 billion chunk of its holding in China Construction Bank on Wednesday, dragging the Chinese bank’s stock 6 percent lower.

headline.main: BofA Sells Bank Stake as Chief Forgoes Bonus
